info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 10:56PM CDT until April 04 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR BUCHANAN...BENTON...NORTHWESTERN DELAWARE AND NORTHWESTERN LINN COUNTIES... At 1055 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Wapsipinicon Golf Course to Minne Estema Park to near Garrison, moving northeast at 20 mph. At 1055 PM CDT, law enforcement reported golf ball size hail west of Independence. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Jesup, Wapsipinicon Golf Course, Otterville, Independence Airport and Littleton around 1100 PM CDT. Independence, Brandon and Buchanan County Fairgrounds around 1105 PM CDT. Lime Creek County Park around 1110 PM CDT. Fontana County Park around 1115 PM CDT. Spencers Grove around 1120 PM CDT. Rowley and Hoefle-Dulin Park around 1130 PM CDT. Walker, Jakway Park and Benton City Park around 1135 PM CDT. Winthrop Golf Course around 1140 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Lime Creek County Park, Winthrop Golf Course, Wapsipinicon Golf Course, Vinton Memorial Airport, Rodgers Park, Benton City Park, Fontana County Park, Pleasant Creek State Recreation Area, Littleton and Hoefle-Dulin Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: These are dangerous storms. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
